Buff.DisplayText: Buff Missing: The buff specified was missing!
%b1 %i1 %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to %i1.
%b1 %i1 Absorption %v1%: Passive: %v1 %b1 Bonus to %i1 Absorption. (Absorption reduces damage from an element by a percentage, after resistance have been taken into account.)
%b1 Accuracy %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to attack rolls

Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 6 to 15 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Improved Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 8 to 20 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Greater Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 12 to 30 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Superior Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 16 to 40 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.

Sovereign Acid Arrow: This bow coats your arrows in corrosive acid. A successful hit douses the target in acid causing an additional 20 to 50 damage after two seconds have passed. Each additional hit extends the duration of the acid damage by two seconds.
Acid I: On Hit: 1 to 4 Acid Damage.
Acid II: On Hit: 2 to 8 Acid Damage.
Acid III: On Hit: 3 to 12 Acid Damage.
Acid IV: On Hit: 4 to 16 Acid Damage.
Acid V: On Hit: 5 to 20 Acid Damage.
%b1 Acid Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Acid spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Acid: This weapon is sheathed in corrosive acid. An acid weapon deals an extra 1 to 6 points of acid damage on a successful hit.
Acidic 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 2d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 3d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 4d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 5d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acidic 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with acid, dealing 6d6 Acid damage on each hit.
Acid Touch: This weapon gives off the faint smell of acid. An acid touch weapon deals an additional +1 acid damage on a successful hit.

Acid Vulnerability: On Hit: Applies a stack of Vulnerable (1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.). This effect may only occur on-hit once every second.
Action Boost Enhancement: This will increase the total number of Action Boosts you can use by 3. However, these additional Action Boosts will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Adamantine: Adamantine weapons may bypass the damage reduction of certain items and creatures.
Adamantine Lined: Adamantine weapons may bypass the damage reduction of certain items and creatures.

Air Guard: This Weapon stores the incredible, dynamic power of the air deep within. When the user of this weapon is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, knocking enemies over or speeding up the wearer with rushing winds.
Alchemical Air Attunement: Attacks and offensive spells have a small chance to deal massive electric damage.

Alchemical Conservation: This item modifies the user's energy expenditure in such a way that many abilities can be used more frequently than normal. You will gain +1 Ki on every successful attack, and you will increase the number of Action Boosts, Turn Undead attempts, and Bard Songs you can use per rest by 1 each.

Anarchic: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 2d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 2: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 2d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 3: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 3d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 4: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 4d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 5: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 5d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)

Anarchic 6: This weapon is chaotic and used to undermine the righteous, dealing an additional 6d6 chaos damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon chaotic aligned. (Lawful characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.)
Hidden effect: Anathema: Increases all threat generated by spells by 25%.

Angelic Grace: When you are hit, 5% chance to gain 150 Temporary Hitpoints. This can only proc once every 10 seconds. These Temporary Hitpoints last for 10 minutes or until used up, whichever is first.

Antimagic Spike: This item was made from powerful antimagic materials. When scoring a critical hit on an enemy with your ranged or melee weapons, the target must make a DC 28 Fortitude save or be unable to cast spells for a brief duration.

Antipodal: This weapon is a carefully balanced confluence of diametrically opposed planar energies. This weapon deals an extra 1d6 points of Good damage to non-Good enemies, an extra 1d6 points of Evil damage to non-Evil enemies, an extra 1d6 points of Law damage to non-Lawful enemies, and an extra 1d6 points of Chaotic damage to non-Chaotic enemies.
Arcane Casting Dexterity: This ability reduces the arcane spell failure chance by -10%.
Armor Bonus %b1: This item surrounds the wearer with an invisible but tangible field of force, granting %b1 armor bonus to AC, just as though he were wearing armor.
%v1 Enhancement Bonus: This item has been magically enhanced. Armor with this quality gains a %v1 Enhancement bonus to AC.
%b1 Armor-Piercing %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Fortification Bypass. (Fortification Bypass makes your attacks ignore a percentage of enemy Fortification.)
%b1 Assassinate %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to the DC of character's Assassinate attempts.
%b1 Attack Bonus %v1: Provides a %v1 %b1 bonus to your attack rolls.

Axiomatic: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 1d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 2: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 2d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 3: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 3d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 4: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 4d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 5: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 5d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic 6: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 6d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Axiomatic Burst: An axiomatic weapon is lawfully aligned and infused with the power of law. It makes the weapon law-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against all of chaotic alignment and an extra 3 to 18 on a critical for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 4 to 24 for a x3 multiplier, and 5 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.

Axiomatic Burst 2: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 2d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 1d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.

Axiomatic Burst 4: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 4d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 9d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.

Axiomatic Burst 6: This weapon is an implement of law, dealing 6d6 Law damage on a successful hit to Chaotic enemies, and 1d6 Law damage on a critical hit to Chaotic enemies. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned.
Bane of the Depths: Your Negative, Poison and Cold spells automatically apply the effects of Bane to enemies struck.

Banishing Weapons: While wearing this item, your melee and ranged weapons gain Vorpal Effect: In addition, on an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit this weapon will banish a creature from this plan of existence. Powerful creatures may resist the vorpal effect until sufficiently wounded.
Bewildering: Targets of this weapon can feel their willpower slipping away. They lose -1 Wisdom on a successful attack.
Blackscale Ferocity: Killing enemies may cause you to fall into a ferocious rage, granting you the benefits of the Haste spell.
Blazing: This weapon is sheathed in fierce flame. A blazing weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 points of fire damage on a successful hit.
Blazing 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 5d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 6d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 7: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 7d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 8: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 8d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 9: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 9d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 10: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 10d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 11: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 11d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 12: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 12d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 13: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 13d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 14: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 14d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Blazing 15: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to coruscate, dealing 15d6 Light damage on each critical hit.
Bleed: This weapon is cruelly sharp and will do an additional 1 to 8 damage to targets that are vulnerable to bleeding.
Bleeding 2: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 2d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 3: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 3d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 4: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 4d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 5: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 5d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bleeding 6: This weapon is wickedly curved, with spines and hooks meant to cause damage to those with flesh. This weapon does 6d8 bleeding damage to those that are vulnerable to it.
Bless Ward: You are warded against the Bless spell.
%b1 Blighted Lore %v1: Passive: Your Acid, Negative, Poison and Evil spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Blindness Immunity: Grants its wearer immunity to blindness effects.

Bloodletter II: On Critical Hit: 5 to 30 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 5 to 40 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 5 to 50 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter III: On Critical Hit: 7 to 42 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 7 to 56 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 7 to 70 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter IV: On Critical Hit: 9 to 54 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 9 to 72 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 9 to 90 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter V: On Critical Hit: 11 to 66 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 11 to 88 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 11 to 110 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter VI: On Critical Hit: 13 to 78 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 13 to 104 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 13 to 130 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.

Bloodletter VII: On Critical Hit: 15 to 90 Slashing damage from weapons with a x2 Critical Multiplier, 15 to 120 Slashing damage from weapons with a x3 Critical Multiplier, and 15 to 150 Slashing damage from weapons with a x4 or greater Critical Multiplier.
Bludgeoning 2: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 2d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 3: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 3d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 4: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 4d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 5: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 5d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Bludgeoning 6: The edges of this weapon are blunted, dealing an additional 6d6 bludgeon damage on each hit.
Blunted Ammunition: The ammunition fired by this weapon deals blunt damage in addition to its other damage types.
Blurry: Equipping this item causes you to become slightly blurry. Attacks from enemies have a 20% chance to miss you due to concealment.
Bodyfeeder: Whenever a bodyfeeder weapon you wield scores a critical hit, you gain 15 temporary hit points that last for up to 1 minute.
Boon of Undeath: Undead take solace in the hate of others. Every time a character wearing a Boon of Undeath item is struck in combat, an Inflict Light Wounds spell will be cast on the character.
Bone Paws: While in any Wild Shape, your weapons gain Piercing damage bypass and +1[W].

Brilliance: This weapon glows with the Light of Irian. This weapon deals an extra 1 to 6 points of Light damage on a successful hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 1 to 10 Light damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 20 for a x3 critical multiplier and 3 to 30 for a x4 multiplier.
Byeshk: Byeshk is effective against Mind Flayers and other aberrations.
Cacophony: This weapon stores the power of a hundred blasts of sound within. Occasionally, this resonating power comes to the surface, devastating enemies with massive sonic damage.

Cannith Combat Infusion: Your ranged and melee attacks have a chance to cause this item to inject a Cannith Combat Infusion into your bloodstream. For the next ten seconds, this will grant a +4 Alchemical bonus to Strength, Constitution and Dexterity, as well as a 5% Alchemical bonus to your chance to doublestrike and a +2 Alchemical bonus to Armor Class.
Chilling 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 2d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 3d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 4d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 5d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chilling 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to become frozen to the touch, dealing 6d6 Ice damage on each hit.
Chimera's Vitality : This item grants extra bonuses if the wearer has been bestowed with Dragonmarks. You gain +1 use of Greater Dragonmark and +5 Quality PRR per Dragonmark you have.
Cold Iron: This iron mined deep underground, known for its effectiveness against Fey creatures, is forged at a lower temperature to preserve its delicate properties.
%b1 Combat Mastery %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to the DC to resist the character's Trip, Improved Trip, Sunder, Improved Sunder, Stunning Blow, and Stunning Fist attempts.
%b1 Combustion %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Fire spell power.
Command %b1: Passive: %b1 Insightful bonus on Charisma based skill checks. Command armor and command shields make their owners very noticeable, imposing a -6 penalty on Hide checks.
Command: Passive: +2 Competence bonus on Charisma based skill checks. Command armor and command shields make their owners very noticeable, imposing a -6 penalty on Hide checks.
Conflagrating: This weapon is sheathed in furious flame. A conflagrating weapon deals an extra 3 to 18 points of fire damage on a successful hit.
Construct Bane 1: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 1d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.
Construct Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to disrupt creations, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Constructs.

Coruscating: This weapon shines with an inner light. A coruscating weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 points of light damage on a successful hit.

%b1 Creeping Dust Lore %v1: Passive: Your Cold and Acid spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Crippling: A crippling weapon is infused with binding power so that when a target is critically hit their movement is slowed by half. (Bug: Actually only a 25% decrease)
Critical Befouling 1: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 1 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Befouling 2: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 2 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Befouling 3: This deadly weapon saps the charm from your enemies, dealing 3 Charisma damage on each critical hit.
Critical Wounding 2: This deadly weapon saps the health from your enemies, dealing 2 Constitution damage on each critical hit.
Critical Wounding 3: This deadly weapon saps the health from your enemies, dealing 3 Constitution damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 4d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 5d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 6d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 7: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 7d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 8: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 8d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 9: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 9d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 10: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 10d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 11: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 11d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Crushing 12: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 12d6 force damage on each critical hit.

Crushing 15: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to ripple with force, dealing 15d6 force damage on each critical hit.
Cursed Level Drain: Each time the player equipping this item is hit there is a small chance it will drain 1 level (no save, almost nothing wards).
Curse of Clumsiness: Passive -1 Penalty to Dexterity. (The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.)
Curse of Dullness: Passive -1 Penalty to Intelligence. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Foolishness: Passive -1 Penalty to Wisdom. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Repulsiveness: Passive -1 Penalty to Charisma. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
Curse of Weakness: Passive -1 Penalty to Strength. The minimum level required to equip this item is lower than normal due to this curse.
%b1 Curse Resistance %b1: Passive: %b1 Enhancement bonus to saves versus curses.
%b1 Dark Restoration Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Negative, Poison and Positive spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
%b1 Deadly %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to weapon damage.
Deathblock: The wearer of this item is immune to all death spells and magical death effects.
%b1 Deception %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to hit and %v2 Damage for Sneak Attacks.

Demon Fever: This weapon is infected with a night hag's Demon Fever disease. On critical hits it will transfer the disease to enemies, dealing 1d8 Constitution damage. A successful Fortitude save (DC 22) negates this effect.
Demonic Might: This item gives the wearer the power of a demon, granting a +2 Profane bonus to Strength.

Destruction: On Hit: Your target gains a stack of Armor Destruction. (-1 penalty to Armor Class, -1% of its Fortification. 20 Second Duration. Stacks up to 15 times.) This effect may trigger once every three seconds.
%b1 Devotion %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Positive (Healing) spell power.
Diehard: If you are incapacitated while this item is equipped, it will automatically stabilize you as if you had the Diehard feat.

Disease - Unholy Tear: This weapon saps the vitality from your enemies, dealing 6d6 Evil damage on each hit. It also has a chance to spread its disease whenever you strike an enemy, which will reduce their Armor Class and Positive Healing Amplification.
Disintegration: This weapon has a dark, insidious power deep within. Occasionally, this power lashes out violently at enemies and attempts to disintegrate them.

Disintegration Guard: This item has a store of dark, insidious power deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally lashes out violently at enemies and attempts to disintegrate them.

Disruption: On Hit: 4 to 24 Bane damage to Undead. On Vorpal Hit: If an undead struck by this weapon has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the undead has above 1000 Hit Points, it takes 100 damage.
%b1 Distant Diversion %v1%: %v1% %b1 bonus to decreased threat generated from ranged damage.
%b1 Diversion %v1%: %v1% %b1 bonus to decreased threat generated from melee damage.
%b1 Dodge %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Dodge.
%b1 Doubleshot %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Doubleshot. Doubleshot is a chance to score an additional hit with a ranged attack.
%b1 Doublestrike %v1%: Passive: %v1% %b1 bonus to Doublestrike. Doublestrike is a chance to score an additional hit with a melee attack.

Dream Vision %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls. Your melee and ranged attacks are also able to bypass the miss chance for attacking Incorporeal enemies as if they had Ghost Touch.
Dusk: Equipping this item engulfs you in twilight shadows. Attacks from enemies have a 10% chance to miss you due to concealment.

Earthgrab Guard: This item stores the implacable strength of the earth deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, calling on the earth to erupt from the ground and hold an enemy in place.
Efficient Metamagic - Embolden II: The additional spell point cost for using the Embolden Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower II: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower Healing I: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Healing Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Empower Healing II: The additional spell point cost for using the Empower Healing Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Enlarge II: The additional spell point cost for using the Enlarge Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Extend I: The additional spell point cost for using the Extend Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Extend II: The additional spell point cost for using the Extend Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Intensify II: The additional spell point cost for using the Intensify Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Maximize I: The additional spell point cost for using the Maximize Metamagic feat is reduced by 1 SP.
Efficient Metamagic - Maximize II: The additional spell point cost for using the Maximize Metamagic feat is reduced by 2 SP.

Elasticity: This bow is strung with special fibers that cause it to occasionally launch arrows with shocking force. When rolling a 19 or 20 on a ranged attack, your critical multiplier is increased by +1.
Electrifying 1: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 1d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 2d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 3: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 3d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 4: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 4d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 5: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 5d6 Lightning damage on each hit.
Electrifying 6: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to arc with electricity, dealing 6d6 Lightning damage on each hit.

Electric Vulnerability: On Hit: Applies a stack of Vulnerable (1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.). This effect may only occur on-hit once every second.
Elemental Manipulation: This item provides a +90 Equipment bonus to your Acid, Cold, Electric, and Fire Spell Power.
%b1 Elemental Resistance %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to your Acid, Cold, Electricity, Fire, and Sonic Resistances.

Elf Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Elves, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
%b1 Enchantment Save %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to your saves versus enchantments
%i1 Energy Absorption %v1%: This effect absorbs %v1% of all %i1 damage the character would have taken, after all other protections have been penetrated.
%b1 %i1 Resistance %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to your %i1 Resistance.
Enfeebling: Critical hits by this weapon deal an extra 1 to 6 points of Strength damage.
Enhanced Ki %v1: Increases the rate at which the user gains Ki with each successful attack.
Entropic: An entropic weapon crackles with a sinister energy that seeks to unmake anything it contacts. When it strikes a target, they take an extra 2 to 12 points of untyped damage.
Evil Outsider Bane: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 1d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 2: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 3: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Evil Outsider Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.

Evil Outsider Bane 6: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt monsters that bring ill intent from other planes, dealing an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Evil Outsiders.
Extra Lay on Hands %v1: You have %v1 Lay on Hands charges.
Extra Smites %v1: %v1 Smite Evil uses per rest. Smite Evil uses regenerate 15% faster.
%b1 False Life %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to hit points.

Feather Falling: This item is engraved with feathers and bestows a powerful magical effect. Whenever the wearer begins to fall from any height, this effect slows the descent dramatically, causing the wearer to fall like a feather.

Feat: Mobility: While equipped this armor grants the wielder the Mobility feat: increases the maximum dexterity bonus permitted by armor and tower shields by 2, adds a +4 bonus to Armor Class while tumbling, and gain a 2% dodge bonus.
Feat: Quick Draw: While equipped, this item grants the feat Quick Draw.
Felling the Oak: On a natural 20 that is confirmed as a critical hit, this weapon will trip your opponent, forcing them to fall prone. There is no save against this effect.
Fiery: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 1d6 Fire damage on each hit.
Fiery 2: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to burn with enchanted flames, dealing 2d6 Fire damage on each hit.

This item also grants a %v1 %b1 bonus to saving throws against magical diseases, and the wearer does not fail saving throws against them on a roll of a natural 1 (this renders the wearer immune to magical diseases with a DC of less than 3 + their Fortitude save).
